website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for soldering smoke and fume removal, and the price is difficult to beat.
cons: The wiring is a bit tricky

customer_reviews.title: Literally the smoke is all sucked in and nothing comes out the exhaust side
customer_reviews.text: Crazy how well this thing works. After using it for a bit I had to show it off to my son in law. I brought him back to my workstation and said check this out the smoke just disappears. Literally the smoke is all sucked in and nothing comes out the exhaust side. Works incredibly good. Buy it you won't be disappointed. I also bought bulk activated charcoal filter material so I can cut my own filters. For ten dollars you can make like 40 filters.
customer_reviews.author: PRIMEMASTER

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected and not too loud. Seems like good quality for the price. I was a little concerned with how thin the carbon/foam filter is but it seems to be working. However, the unit came with 1 filter installed and 1 extra so I went ahead and stacked both inside. It works better than just 1 and doesn't seem to affect the fan suction much if at all.
customer_reviews.author: Oldtownroller

customer_reviews.title: A must have for soldering. Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to save my health since I do a lot of soldering and do not use lead free solder (doesn't work as good). For the price you can't beat it. It is well built and the fan is very powerful and has no problem at all sucking up solder fumes even from a foot away. I should have purchased this much earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Aviator

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: Essential if you are doing any soldering. The only reason for not 5 stars is that because the wires are connected to the plug by wire twist. Wish it was a straight connection. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel

customer_reviews.title: A bit noisy
customer_reviews.text: Works well for venting the area but is quite noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Sb

customer_reviews.title: The filter that comes with it is very thin but ...
customer_reviews.text: The filter that comes with it is very thin but it does the job still. I got some thicker filters but I have to use tape around the side to hold the rubber filter cover on, and also keep the suction working. It does what it's supposed to though.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Wilson III

customer_reviews.title: The device works, but I doubt the cord would withstand contact with a soldering iron.  No CE/UL.
customer_reviews.text: The device does work. It is pretty loud. However, it does not appear to be UL or CE approved (the switch is, and the fan is CE approved - but there is no indication of approval of the entire assembly.) I doubt that the cord would withstand accidental contact with a soldering iron, presenting a potential shock hazard. Still, a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: cube1

customer_reviews.title: I consider this a dangerous product
customer_reviews.text: I reported it to the U.S. Consumer Products Safety Commission. We will see what they conclude. Stay safe. Note the attached picture with no tie down for the cable which is directly connected to the fan with wire only covered with heat shrink. The U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) has posted your Report No. 20190206-F17F6-2147382869 on SaferProducts. gov (remove the space in front of gov for the website and enter the report number.
customer_reviews.author: P. Marino

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It does a good job for the size of the unit. Everything else relatively similar online was either way too weak, way too large, or way too expensive. This hits the sweet spot for hobby soldering.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Does was it is supposed to do. I use this to extract the fumes while soldering. Smoke goes in -- none comes out. It seems to work even at 12 inches away. Impressed with its power. Noisy though but I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Fume Sucker 5000
customer_reviews.text: This fan does a good enough job pulling the fumes as I use it with my new soldering station. It even came with a replacement filter. It’s good.
customer_reviews.author: COM3IT Solutions, LLC.

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: This thing doesn't "suck" very much, which in a way makes it suck more, but in a bad way. Even the vapor it does pull in doesn't get completely filtered, it does reduce it about 75% - but given the tests so far have been small amounts of vapor, it really should perform better, especially with a new filter. I gave it one more star for it's construction, it's solid, and the power cable they use has good feel to it, FWIW.
customer_reviews.author: peggy heasley

customer_reviews.title: Meets our needs
customer_reviews.text: I like the rocket switch placement as we have our unit placed up in a windowsill. . It is a bit noisier than I expected and less suction than I expected. BUT it still does a decent job of extracting fumes and smoke. Comes with an extra filter also which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: I should of bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I have been soldering projects since 1995, i just had a fan blowing smoke away, it worked but annoying. I bought this and should of done it years and years ago. This is one of the better purchases i have made. If you do a lot of soldering get this.......period.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Iffland

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, it's a fan and a filter.
customer_reviews.text: Basically it's just a simple fan and a cover to hold a carbon filter. I can see my solder smoke get sucked right in, I keep it just a few inches away from my work. I put the spare filter in as well to get better filtering. It is not quiet, but not unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient for hobby use
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much smoke is actually being absorbed but I do notice less smell while soldering. I think it's sufficient for hobby usage. Very powerful little fan for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sutton Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Good, though don't expect it to absorb fumes.
customer_reviews.text: The charcoal filter element is a joke, but besides that, the fan works great... So yes, it's good at extracting and probably absorbing for the first 5-10 minutes of smoke but after that I highly doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Theodore

customer_reviews.title: Price can't be Beat
customer_reviews.text: Solid, but doesn't seem to be the ultimate quality. But for the price it can't be beat, carbon filter seems thin but it seems to do the job and the difference is huge.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with solder and flux fumes
customer_reviews.text: This fan makes a huge difference when soldering. It absorbs most of the fumes from the solder and flux.
customer_reviews.author: Chue X

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It's small enough to place anywhere, could work as a to-go fan as well. It makes a decent amount of noise, but most exhausts do and I don't mind it too much. If you don't own an exhaust fan for soldering, you need one and this is currently the cheapest one on amazon that'll get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Amazing solder smoker - the best one on the market for the price. This gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Christie K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This fan a very simple, yet practical design that worked better than expected. It's not much more than a decked-out fan, but don't let that deter you. It sucked up any solder gases before I could smell the fumes/smoke.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: OK for some time
customer_reviews.text: It is okay and not too loud but once the filter get full of dirt you will need to change the product itself
customer_reviews.author: SnipeDeals

customer_reviews.title: A disapointment
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work. The in-line power switch was broken when i got it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Dennison

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Does what I thought it would do. Great customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: Unit does a great job at sucking up the fumes. It's compact so you might need to have the unit a little closer, but I think the suction is really good overall. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It does it's job.
customer_reviews.text: It works great with pulling smoke and fumes away from me.
customer_reviews.author: asmill59

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: Suction is pretty good. Seems to be doing what its supposed to. Not bad for the price I guess.
customer_reviews.author: TychiBalls

customer_reviews.title: More then expected
customer_reviews.text: Strong fan ready to move air came with a filter in it and an extra. Nice long cord with a good feeling switch inline
customer_reviews.author: Alan Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Good ventilation.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Not too loud for the air moved.
customer_reviews.author: KENNETH BAIR

customer_reviews.title: It worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a compact ventilation system for my workshop. This did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Familiar

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tested it yet but it seems really well made.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Blount

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I use this smoke extractor for my engraving machine and it is perfect, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It works well. Don't have any issue with fumes/smoke in my face.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great working suction filter for soldering
customer_reviews.text: Makes my solder smoke magically disappear. Very good utility for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jill E.

customer_reviews.title: works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I like this little big smoker absorber. Is compact and portable, won't take lot of room. Easy to use and really works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, does what it needs to for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley B.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Feels solidly built, comes with an extra filter, has a switch inline on the power cord. Makes an excellent whirring noise as it spins up.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: Wishing the filters didn't need cleaning as often but I do run mine a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Game

customer_reviews.title: size issue
customer_reviews.text: The unit is actually 5in X 5in X 2in smaller than listed size. sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Knackstedt

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great little fan works perfectly for pyrography work definitely recommend impressive for it's size
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I like it for what I do. I thought it’d be bigger tho!
customer_reviews.author: Val Jean Turk

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this smoke eater it works great! Small enough to not get in the way but strong enough to get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: and it works fine. BUT
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this product.. it does what it's supposed to, and it works fine. BUT, upon inspecting it when I received it, instead of all the wires coming together, the wires are separated and are connected by a wire nut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny. buy it trust me
customer_reviews.text: couldn't be any happier. works really well and air suction is powerful. exactly what i needed for my hobby soldering projects.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Max

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Regrettably I was too busy and missed the return window or I would have sent this product back. Complete junk waste of money. Does nothing to remove fumes or smell.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope Auerbach

customer_reviews.title: love this little 4x4 fan for desktop use, works very well for crafters, and it is not noisy
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased four of these. Using two in an area where people smoke cigarettes--they sit at a table during breaks. This fan draws in the smoke very well, if the people are no more than 2 feet away from the fan. It sure has improved the air quality in the break room and there is less lingering odor. The other two are used by artists -- they use them to draw paint fumes away from their faces -- and also use them for drying the model cars they paint.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming

product_meta.title: Kulannder Handy Carry Solder Smoker Absorber Remover Fume Extrator Smoke Prevention Absorber DIY Working Fan
feature_bullets: The Powerful Remove Fume Extrator and handy carry
Long-lasting working time for over 50,000 hours
Great for electronics, arts and crafts, and stained glass work

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars176 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
